1.title: Center for Policing Equity
1.subtitle: Your donation fuels our ability to lead on the police reform that's necessary. Together we will create a public safety system that protects and preserves justice for all.

1.title: AllGoudes & Services
1.subtitle: Whether you have a college degree and are seeking to make your first steps onto your career path, or just looking to secure steady income by obtaining an entry level position; AllGoudes and Services makes sure that you’ll be ALLGOUDE in your job search! It’s your time! Let us help you display your worth to potential employers.

2.title: How studying privilege systems can strengthen compassion
2.subtitle: Her TED Talk offers a shift in the traditional view of race, equity and privilege. McIntosh uses her own experience as a white woman to inform her own knowledge of racial experiences from a white perspective.

2.title: McBride Sisters Winery
2.subtitle: Since 2005, The McBride Sisters’ mission has become clear—to transform the industry, lead by example, and cultivate community, one delcious glass of wine, at a time.

products.name: McBride Sisters Collection Black Girl Magic 2018 California Merlot
products.description: This juicy and sensational wine is a classic Merlot, sophisticated for the wine connoisseur and delicious for the wine novices.

products.name: McBride Sisters Collection Black Girl Magic NV New Zealand Sparkling Brut
products.description: Your new favorite sparkling wine. Pop the bubbly for any celebration or for the days you want to feel extra fancy. You deserve it.

products.name: SHE CAN 4-Pack Sampler
products.description: Yes SHE CAN have it all! Enjoy our most popular sampler including one of each flavor. Four cans is the equivalent of two bottles of wine and an amazing value for these delicious wines and spritzers.

3.title: Oh-Mazing!
3.subtitle: Yes, we sell granola (it's quite tasty), but more importantly, we want to inspire you to live your life with purpose, passion, and to follow your dreams. Our products are here to bring the adventure back to snacking, and better yet, celebrate YOU when those dreams are achieved.

products.name: Original Recipe
products.description: The Original Recipe blend has a sweet caramel flavor that makes it simply delicious. There are so many ways to enjoy this treat--topping on your yogurt, adding some crunch to your favorite ice cream, or creating a crust for a cheesecake.

products.name: Lemon Bar
products.description: Lemon Bar will please the palate of all lemon lovers and add a refreshing flavor to a bowl of oatmeal or a new bite to your favorite cheesecake recipe.

products.name: Caribbean Delight
products.description: Caribbean Delight is our first vegan product. The ingredients include coconut oil, grated coconut, and a touch of raisins that will make your palate dance. Not to mention, you will immediately be reminded of that time you went on an island vacation.

3.title: The Black Family in the Age of Mass Incarceration
3.subtitle: By author Ta-Nehisi Coates: Fifty years after Daniel Patrick Moynihan’s report “The Negro Family” tragically helped create this system, it's time to reclaim his original intent.

4.title: MLK: The Other America
4.subtitle: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.’s 1967 speech at Stanford. Here, he expounds on his nonviolent philosophy and methodology.

4.title: Shades of My Melanin LLC
4.subtitle: At Shades of My Melanin, our goal is to not only offer products that make you feel beautiful in your own skin but to offer products that tell a story for each and every person who wears them. We offer fun, colorful, and creative products that can be worn by all ages.

5.title: Ruth Nathan's
5.subtitle: It is Nicole R. Brown's desire that Ruth Nathan’s does not only make customers look spectacular but feel spectacular as well, positively influencing them to feel better about themselves. It is a known fact that when one dresses well, one feels better—and from an outfit that is well put together, that makes one walk with pride, the Urban Peacock emerges.

products.name: Blue Curved Mask
products.description: Still want to look dapper while protecting yourself and others? We have the answer! Reusable and re-washable, these fabric masks will keep you looking good and doing good. When you buy a curved face mask from Ruth Nathan’s we donate a rectangular face mask to health care professionals and essential workers in need.

products.name: Franc Bleu Bow Tie
products.description: The deep older brother of the Franc Un pattern, the Franc Bleu’s watercolor pen lines convey elegance and a truly historic sense of style. Also inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Bleu carries notes of art deco, dancing under the stars, and midnight.

products.name: Franc Un Pocket Square
products.description: Inspired by French Polynesian currency, the Franc Un pattern gives off a refined yet playful vibe sure to elevate your look during formal occasions. Perfect for when you want to be taken seriously—but not too seriously. Notes of Art Deco, French Quarter jazz, and pistachios.

5.title: Microaggressions Are A Big Deal: How To Talk Them Out And When To Walk Away
5.subtitle: Microaggressions are defined as the everyday, subtle, intentional — and oftentimes unintentional — interactions or behaviors that communicate some sort of bias toward historically marginalized groups. Learn more in this podcast from NPR.

6.title: Mojo Jojo Pickles
6.subtitle: Mojo Jojo Pickles was started in 2011 as a commercial venture of a Slow Food Edmonton Canning Bee project Johwanna "Jojo" Alleyne started in 2010. Mojo Jojo Pickles has expanded to include many creative acidified and spirited preserved foods from pickles to condiments, beverage syrups, and shrubs.

products.name: Popular Pickle Pack
products.description: A collection of our most popular pickles: kim chi style brussels sprout, traditional pickled carrot, pickled snow pea, and lemon balsamic asparagus.

products.name: Brandied Saskatoon Berries
products.description: Whole Alberta Saskatoons in a cane sugar and whisky syrup.  Great for breakfast, desserts and cocktails.

products.name: Gingerbread Apple Butter
products.description: These fruit butters are made by slow-cooking fruit and cane sugar until it forms a thick creamy paste. We then add real vanilla and spice to enhance these flavours. Great on toast or pancakes but Divine with fine cheese.

6.title: Classify White Supremacist Groups as Domestic Terrorist Organizations
6.subtitle: Request a new legal requirement to register, classify, and subsequently surveil white supremacist organizations as domestic terrorist organizations. By classifying these groups as intimidating to the American population and dangerous to human life, the institutions responsible for protecting citizens against such groups will have the necessary information and resources to prevent further destruction carried out by these violent terrorist groups.

7.title: "ABC I Love Me"
7.subtitle: ABC I Love Me takes Black children along for a journey of self love, confidence, and adventure while teaching young learners positive affirmations for each letter of the alphabet. This book encourages children to accept their unique qualities, and promotes positive self-esteem and a healthy lifestyle.

7.title: The Collective PAC
7.subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

8.title: Shy Chy Books
8.subtitle: Shy Chy Books will offer a series of books all about encouraging children to be themselves and embracing their individuality. The first book, I can't, I can't... I CAN! is about a girl who desires to make friends and participate in different activities, but she is held back by her shyness.

products.name: Ujamaa Smart LED Light Bulb

products.name: #BLACKOUT T-Shirt
products.description: The #BLACKOUT movement was organized to bring awareness to police brutality and racism towards the African-American people. This t-shirt was designed in honor of the efforts to bring peace and equality to Black people worldwide.

products.name: Ujamaa Lighting Heavy Hoodie

12.title: Afro Flow Yoga
12.subtitle:
With over 14 years of experience, Leslie Salmon Jones continues to pursue an active interdisciplinary career in health and dance in Boston and New York City. A Toronto native, Leslie received her B.A. in Dance and Health Studies at the State University of New York, and her Fitness Instructors Certification at New York University. She was a scholarship recipient at the esteemed Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre in New York City as well as the London Contemporary Dance School.

As a professional dancer, Leslie worked with known greats such as Judith Jameson, Bill T. Jones and Wynton Marsalis. At her studio in New York, she developed her own exercise program based on various techniques honed through working with her personal training clientele on a daily basis. Today she continues to divide her time between New York City and Boston.

Leslie has extensive experience in the fitness industry, including being a consultant for the New York Knicks healthy lifestyle clinic that teaches self-esteem to youth. She also served as a board member for the organization, Free Arts for Abused Kids, NYC. Today, she serves as a board member of the United Nations Association of New York

12.title: The Hate U Give
12.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

13.title: Kintu New York
13.subtitle: Kintu handbags are designed in New York, co-developed with global artisans, and made in Italy. The Kintu brand appeals to the dynamic, busy, urban woman who values quality and self-expression.

14.subtitle: They view the success of black students as central to the success of their own teaching. Read more from Pirette McKamey, principal of San Francisco’s Mission High School and an anti-racist educator for more than 30 years.

15.title: Martin Luther King Jr.’s ‘Letter From Birmingham Jail’
15.subtitle: In April 1963, King was jailed in Birmingham, Alabama. While there, he wrote a lengthy letter in the margins of a newspaper, and smuggled it out with the help of his lawyer. The eloquent call for “constructive, nonviolent tension” to force an end to unjust laws became a landmark document of the civil-rights movement.

15.title: Perfect Blue Alchemy

products.name: Elevate Body Butter

17.title: Support our Young Protest Leaders #freetianna
17.subtitle: On Tuesday, July 21, Tianna Arata was arrested by San Luis Obispo PD at about 8 p.m. near Mitchell Park as she and other demonstrators were loading up a car after the protest had already dispersed.

17.title: Racially Targeted Arrests in the Era of Marijuana Reform
17.subtitle: For decades, marijuana laws have been used to criminalize Black and Brown people, waste taxpayer money, and fuel the mass incarceration crisis. However, states across the country are taking strides toward reforming these outdated and harmful policies.

18.title: Remembering Henry Lewis, first Black conductor of a major symphony orchestra
18.subtitle: Henry Lewis’ love and passion for music and symphony was indescribable.

18.title: Whistling Vivaldi
18.subtitle: Claude M. Steele, who has been called "one of the few great social psychologists," offers a vivid first-person account of the research that supports his groundbreaking conclusions on stereotypes and identity.

19.title: Constance Baker Motley: Judiciary’s Unsung Rights Hero
19.subtitle: Constance Baker Motley was an unlikely civil rights hero. An African American who grew up near Yale University, she did not personally experience overt racism until late in high school, and as a young person she was almost totally unaware of black history.

19.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
19.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

22.title: Why Many Americans Can’t See The Wealth Gap Between White And Black America
22.subtitle: In the last year and a quarter, the pandemic has served as a stark reminder of just how unequal America still is. But it also hasn’t been a “reminder” for everyone. Black Americans and other Americans of color didn’t have the luxury of forgetting that American society is unequal.

22.title: Change.org: Justice for Daunte Wright
22.subtitle: 20 year old man Daunte Wright, a father to a two year old, was murdered by Minneapolis-area police. Help get him and his family justice by signing this petition.

23.title: Color blind or color brave?
23.subtitle: The subject of race can be very touchy. As finance executive Mellody Hobson says, it's a "conversational third rail." But, she says, that's exactly why we need to start talking about it. In this engaging, persuasive talk, Hobson makes the case that speaking openly about race — and particularly about diversity in hiring — makes for better businesses and a better society.

23.title: Automotive Heroes of Black History Month
23.subtitle: Ever wonder what driving would be like without turn signals or traffic lights? Well, without these great inventors, engineers, scientists, and pioneers of their field, driving wouldn’t be what it is today! In celebration of Black History Month, we want to share a few of their exciting stories with you.

24.title: Daunte Wright was stopped for expired plates, but driving while Black may have been his 'crime'
24.subtitle: The police confrontation escalated after officers saw what could have been an air freshener hanging illegally from the rearview mirror.

24.title: AuxGod

products.name: AuxGod: Hip Hop + RNB

25.subtitle: Winona Guo '22 co-authored a book on race, culture, and identity as a resource for teachers.

25.title: Colorism in the Beauty Industry
25.subtitle: America has progressed tremendously over recent years in terms of racial inequality, but colorism remains to be seen on a global scale.

26.title: The RACE Method Of Talking To A Racism Skeptic
26.subtitle: The RACE Method is an approach that anti-racism allies can take to trying to share their perspective with people who are skeptical that racism against people of color is a problem worthy of specific attention. It is based on principles from non-violent communication and on findings from the science of persuasion.

26.title: Amanda Gorman Inauguration Poem

28.title: Book: Understanding Mass Incarceration
28.subtitle: A People's Guide to the Key Civil Rights Struggle of Our Time

28.title: Dr. Ernest Everett Just
28.subtitle: Dr. Ernest Just was a pioneering African American biologist, academic and science writer. Just's primary legacy is his recognition of the fundamental role of the cell surface in the development of organisms.

29.title: Coily and Cute
29.subtitle: Sharee has loved art all her life and has taken every opportunity to study it. She runs one of the Black-owned companies where customers can buy art prints.

29.title: Open Yale Courses: African American History: From Emancipation to the Present
29.subtitle: The purpose of this course is to examine the African American experience in the United States from 1863 to the present. Prominent themes include the end of the Civil War and the beginning of Reconstruction; African Americans’ urbanization experiences; the development of the modern civil rights movement and its aftermath; and the thought and leadership of Booker T. Washington, Ida B. Wells-Barnett, W.E.B. Du Bois, Marcus Garvey, Martin Luther King Jr., and Malcolm X.

30.title: Daunte's Funeral and future care of Daunte Jr.
30.subtitle: Please donate to give Daunte Wright the proper burial he deserves and to help his son and son's mother Chyna. And if you can't support financially, please send lots of prayers for the family to get through this tragic loss.
